intro: Astrephia lobata, commonly known as the lobed astrephia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are divided into five to seven lobes. Its showy, five-petaled flowers are typically pink or purple, blooming in clusters. Astrephia lobata thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils.
